title: Travis Waddell
text:
Travis Waddell (born 11 July 1989) is an Australian professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays for the <a href="Souths%20Logan%20Magpies">Souths Logan Magpies</a> in the <a href="Queensland%20Cup">Intrust Super Cup</a>. He plays as a . He previously played for the <a href="Canberra%20Raiders">Canberra Raiders</a>, <a href="Newcastle%20Knights">Newcastle Knights</a> and most recently the <a href="Brisbane%20Broncos">Brisbane Broncos</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">National Rugby League</a>.
Background.
Born in <a href="Proserpine%2C%20Queensland">Proserpine, Queensland</a>, Waddell played his junior football for the <a href="Proserpine%2C%20Queensland%23Sports%20and%20facilities">Proserpine Brahmans</a>, before being signed by the <a href="Souths%20Logan%20Magpies">Souths Logan Magpies</a>.
Playing career.
Canberra.
After a year with the Souths Logan Magpies, Waddell signed a contract with the <a href="Canberra%20Raiders">Canberra Raiders</a>. He played for the Raiders' <a href="National%20Youth%20Competition%20%28rugby%20league%29">NYC</a> team in 2008 and 2009, scoring 15 tries in 39 games.
In Round 3 of the <a href="2009%20NRL%20season">2009 NRL season</a>, Waddell made his <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a> debut for the Raiders against the <a href="Parramatta%20Eels">Parramatta Eels</a>.
At the end of 2009, Waddell was named at in the NYC Team of the Year.
In 2010, Waddell was selected in the inaugural <a href="Indigenous%20All%20Stars%20%28rugby%20league%29">Indigenous All Stars</a> team to play the <a href="NRL%20All%20Stars%20team">NRL All Stars</a> at <a href="Skilled%20Park">Skilled Park</a> on the <a href="Gold%20Coast%2C%20Queensland">Gold Coast, Queensland</a>. He was again selected in 2011, 2012 and 2013.
Waddell was a regular in the Raiders team in 2010, despite being off the field for 10 weeks with a broken jaw.
Waddell started 2011 again as a regular, but was dropped from the first-grade team as the Raiders struggled, and joined feeder club Souths Logan Magpies for the remainder of the year.
Waddell played 21 games for the Raiders in 2012. At the end of the year he was released.
Newcastle.
In 2013, Waddell returned to the Souths Logan Magpies in the <a href="Queensland%20Cup">Queensland Cup</a>. However, in January, <a href="Newcastle%20Knights">Newcastle Knights</a> coach, <a href="Wayne%20Bennett%20%28rugby%20league%29">Wayne Bennett</a> asked Waddell to come and train with the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a> team a week each month while still playing for Souths Logan, with Knights CEO <a href="Matthew%20Gidley">Matthew Gidley</a> revealing that Waddell would train with the team in case he was needed during the season for the Knights.
On 4 March 2013, Waddell signed a 2-year contract with the <a href="Newcastle%20Knights">Newcastle Knights</a>, 3 days before the start of the <a href="2013%20NRL%20season">2013 NRL season</a>.
In June 2013, the Knights released Waddell back to the Souths Logan Magpies in the <a href="Queensland%20Cup">Queensland Cup</a> for the remainder of the 2013 season but he returned to the Knights in 2014 on a full-time deal.
Brisbane.
In September 2014, Newcastle Knights coach Wayne Bennett revealed that Waddell would be following him to the <a href="Brisbane%20Broncos">Brisbane Broncos</a> in 2015 on a 2-year contract.
Personal life.
Waddell's mother is from <a href="Badu%20Island">Badu Island</a> in the <a href="Torres%20Strait">Torres Strait</a>, his father is, <a href="Aboriginal%20Australians">Aboriginal</a> and from <a href="Darwin%2C%20Northern%20Territory">Darwin, Northern Territory</a>. He is also of <a href="Ni-Vanuatu">Vanuatuan</a> descent.
Waddell is related to Newcastle Knights player <a href="Dane%20Gagai">Dane Gagai</a>, <a href="Gold%20Coast%20Titans">Gold Coast Titans</a> player <a href="Josh%20Hoffman">Josh Hoffman</a> and <a href="Australian%20Football%20League">AFL</a> players <a href="Daniel%20Motlop">Daniel</a>, <a href="Steven%20Motlop">Steven</a>, <a href="Shannon%20Motlop">Shannon</a> and <a href="Marlon%20Motlop">Marlon Motlop</a>.
